titleInfo.title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 3

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. The file may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed without permission. End users must obtain all required permissions or consents from the owners of such rights. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: The recording is of Roy Acuff's Royal Crown sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number three of an unidentified number. The tape features multiple recordings. The additional recordings are sponsored by American Ace Coffee. The recording features Grant Turner (host) and Louie Buck (host) and features performances by: Bradley Kincaid (musician), Curly Fox (musician), Roy Acuff (musician/host), Jimmie Riddle (musician), Pap Wilson (musician), Tommy Jackson (musician), Flatt and Scruggs (musicial duo), Bill Monroe (musician), the Smokey Mountain Belles (musicial group), and the Oak Ridge Quartet (musicial duo). The tape is from a multitude of dates from: November 22, 1947; and November 29, 1947.

subject.topic: Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys (Musical group)

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
